content.raw:
I agree with removing the operators, the new API looks much better

I think using `std::set` or `std::unordered_set` in place of the `std::vectors` in the API may make more sense, so that we can guarantee that we aren’t getting duplicate Entity or ComponentTypeIds \(unless there is a need for this?\)  
Also, I think a good follow-on would be to have  masked versions of `SetState` so that we can mask out particular entities or component types that we want to update.
content.html:
I agree with removing the operators, the new API looks much better

I think using std::set or std::unordered_set in place of the std::vectors in the API may make more sense, so that we can guarantee that we aren’t getting duplicate Entity or ComponentTypeIds (unless there is a need for this?)
Also, I think a good follow-on would be to have masked versions of SetState so that we can mask out particular entities or component types that we want to update.
